alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 9:46AM CDT until March 27 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in St Louis MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Middle Fabius River near Ewing. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Middle Fabius River near Ewing. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Monday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 12.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Sun Mon Tue Wed Thu Middle Fabius River Ewing 12.0 8.4 12.4 10.7 7.5 6.1 4.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The National Weather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
